name: 陳秉訓
objective: This course teaches a variety of legal doctrines and laws or regulations regarding patent drafting. Primarily, this course focuses on American practices. But, if requested, European, Taiwan and China practices are also covered for comparison purposes. Students will be assigned to read court decisions. Technical backgrounds are not required for taking this course. Class participation is also required. Writing assignments regarding patent drafting might be given.
schedule:
Module 1: Thoeries of patent drafting
Class 1 Introduction
Class 2 History of Claims
--Merrill v. Yeomans, 94 U.S. 568 (1876); White v. Dunbar, 119 U.S. 47 (1886); Continental Paper Bag Co. v. Eastern Paper Bag Co., 210 U.S. 405 (1908); McCarty v. Lehigh Val R Co., 160 U.S. 110 (1895); Aro Mfg. Co. v. Convertible Top Replacement Co., 365 U.S. 336 (1961).
Class 3 Claim Construction
--Litigation: Markman v. Westview Instruments, Inc., 517 U.S. 370 (1996); Phillips v. AWH Corp., 363 F.3d 1207 (Fed. Cir. 2004); Markman v. Westview Instruments, Inc., 52 F.3d 967 (Fed Cir. 1995).
--Prosectuion: In re Buszard, 504 F.3d 1364 (Fed. Cir. 2007) (examination); In re Sneed, 710 F.2d 1544 (Fed. Cir. 1983) (reissue); In re Yamamoto, 740 F.2d 1569 (Fed. Cir. 1984) (re-examination).
Class 4 Preamable
--CLAIMCFC §§ 2:1, 2:3, 2:4, 2.5, 2.6, 2.7, 2.8, 2.9, 2.10, 2.11, 2.12 
--“Preamble-within-a preamble” format: Microprocessor Enhancement Corp. v. Texas Instruments Inc.
520 F.3d 1367 (Fed. Cir. 2008); HTC Corp. v. IPCom GmbH & Co., KG, 667 F.3d 1270 (Fed. Cir. 2012).
Class 5 Written Description
--Vas-Cath Inc. v. Mahurkar, 935 F.2d 1555 (Fed. Cir. 1991); ICN Photonics, Ltd. v. Cynosure, Inc., 73 Fed. Appx. 425 (Fed. Cir. 2003); Zenon Environmental, Inc. v. U.S. Filter Corp., 506 F.3d 1370 (Fed. Cir. 2007).
Class 6 Enablement
--In re Wands, 858 F.2d 731 (Fed. Cir. 1988); Monsanto Co. v. Syngenta Seeds, Inc., 503 F.3d 1352 (Fed. Cir. 2007); Sitrick v. Dreamworks, LLC, 516 F.3d 993 (Fed. Cir. 2008).
Class 7 Means-plus-function Claims
--TriMed, Inc. v. Stryker Corp., 514 F.3d 1256 (Fed. Cir. 2008); Aristocrat Techs. Australia Pty Ltd. v. Int’l Game Tech., 521 F.3d 1328 (Fed. Cir. 2008) (concerning the means-plus-function limitation).

Module 2: Project-based learning
Class 8 Team 1 project proposal-Common Terms
--CLAIMCFC § 6:2
Class 9 Team 2 project proposal-Claim Differentiation
--Liebel-Flarsheim Co. v. Medrad, Inc., 358 F.3d 898 (Fed. Cir. 2004); Andersen Corp. v. Fiber Composites, LLC, 474 F.3d 1361 (Fed. Cir. 2007).

Module 3: Issues on software patent drafting
In Module 3, I will invite a guest speaker to teach six classes.

scorePolicy:
Raw scores are calculated based on the following rules:

5 written assignments: at most 10 points for each one. One oral presentation: at most 15 points. One term paper: at most 35 points.
materials:
1. The references can be found in the Westlaw database: U.S. casese; Claim Construction in the Federal Circuit.
2. This course is not designed to help you take the Taiwan patent bar examination.
3. You are not required to have any technical backgroud before taking this course. This course will not focus on technological aspects of patent drafting.
